ActQuarantine Act
SubjectMinimizing the Risk of Exposure to COVID-19 in Canada Order (Mandatory Isolation), No. 7
PrecisMINIMIZING THE RISK OF EXPOSURE TO COVID-19 IN CANADA ORDER (MANDATORY ISOLATION), NO. 7 in order to (1) support Canadaâ€™s continued focus on reducing the introduction and further spread of COVID-19 by decreasing the risk of importing cases from outside the country; (2) maintain the previous requirements that all persons who enter Canada, whether by air, land, rail and sea, are required to answer questions to determine if they have signs or symptoms of COVID-19, and, with limited exceptions, quarantine or isolate for 14 days from the day upon which they entered Canada; (3) continue to require persons entering Canada to provide information requested; (4) introduce authorities to mandate pre-border and post-border information reporting for travelers; (5) specify further conditions on the compassionate grounds exemption; (6) add exemptions relating to students who regularly cross the Canada-U.S. border for school, dependent children subject to cross-border custody arrangements, residents of certain isolated cross-border communities and persons denied entry to the U.S. at a land border and immediately turned back; and (7) enable joint federal-provincial pilot projects for an alternative approach to the current 14-day quarantine requirement.
